revised_title: The Illumination of Lines of Molecular Pressure and the Trajectory of Molecules
tldr: The author investigates the dark space phenomenon and the trajectory of molecules in various gases, such as air, hydrogen, and carbonic acid, using a specialized glass bulb and an induction coil. The results show that the size and appearance of the dark space surrounding the negative pole vary depending on the gas and pressure, and that heating the pole causes the dark space to expand.
